# What is *R*?

*R* is a powerful programming language and software for statistical computing and graphics.

* *R* is freely available under the "GNU General Public License".
* *R* project homepage: [https://www.r-project.org/](https://www.r-project.org/).

<!-- According to @PaarschGolyaev2016Gentle *R* is the "lingua franca" among statisticians. -->

<!--..........................................................................-->
<hr />

# What is *RStudio*?

*R* has no (native) Graphical User Interface (*GUI*) or Integrated Development Environment (*IDE*).

*GUIs*/*IDEs* are provided by third-party software.

One of the most popular and free of charge *GUI*/*IDE* for *R* is *RStudio*.

*RStudio* is not necessary to use *R* but it makes it easier.

# Installation of *R* and *RStudio*

<!-- <hr /> -->

<p class="head01">
Step 1: Installation of *R*
</p>

1. Go to [CRAN Mirrors](https://cran.r-project.org/mirrors.html)
2. Choose a mirror located close to your internet connection, e.g., "GWDG GÃ¶ttingen".
3. Download and install *R* for your operating system, e.g., "Windows".

<!--..........................................................................-->
<!-- <hr /> -->

<p class="head01">
Step 2: Installation of *RStudio*
</p>

1. Go to [download *RStudio*](https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/)
2. Choose "RStudio Desktop Open Source License"
3. Download and install *RStudio* for your operating system, e.g., "Windows".
